title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Addition of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Addition of 
Vitamins and Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2023. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the European Union (Addition of Vitamins 
and Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 226 of 2018), the Regulations of 2021 and these 
Regulations may be cited together as the European Union (Addition of Vitamins 
and Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) Regulations 2017 to

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means European Union (Addition of Vitamins and 
Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 
376 of 2017); 

“Regulations of 2021” means European Union (Addition of Vitamins and 
Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) (Amendment) Regulations 
2021 (S.I. No. 541 of 2021).

text_raw:
3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations (as last amended by Regulation 

3 of the Regulations of 2021) is amended— 

(a) 

by substituting for the definition of “Annex III to EC Regulation 
1925/2006” the following: 

‘“Annex III to EC Regulation 1925/2006’ means Annex III to 
Regulation (EC) No. 1925/2006 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 20 December 20063, as amended by 
Commission Regulation (EU) 2015/403 of 11 March 20154, 
Commission Regulation (EU) 2019/649 of 24 April 20195,

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 4. Regulation 8 of the Principal Regulations (as last amended by Regulation
text_raw:
4. Regulation 8 of the Principal Regulations (as last amended by Regulation 
4 of the Regulations of 2021) is amended by substituting for Regulation 8, the 
following: 

“(1) Subject to paragraph (2), a food business operator who— 

(a) 

adds to food, uses in the manufacture of food, or places on 
the market a food containing— 

(i) 

(ii) 

a prohibited substance listed in Part A of Annex III to 
EC Regulation 1925/2006, or 

a restricted substance listed in Part B of Annex III to 
EC Regulation 1925/2006 in a manner contrary to the 
conditions of use specified therein, 

(b) 

supplies other food business operators with food not 
intended for the final consumer or not intended for supply 

6 OJ No. L 110, 25.4.2019, p. 21. 
7 OJ No. L 96, 19.3.2021, p. 6. 
8 OJ No. L 39, 13.2.2008, p. 11. 
9 OJ No. L 314, 1.12.2009, p. 36. 
10 OJ No. L 296, 15.11.2011, p. 29. 
11 OJ No. L 304, 22.11.2011, p. 18. 
12 OJ No. L 102, 12.4.2012, p. 2. 
13 OJ No. L 39, 8.2.2014, p. 44. 

 
 
 
 4 [265] 

to retail, without providing information on the amount of 
trans fat, other than trans fat naturally occurring in fat of 
animal origin, where that amount exceeds 2 grams per 100 
grams of fat, or 

(c) 

otherwise supplies a food in a manner contrary to the 
additional requirements contained in Part B of Annex III to 
EC Regulation 1925/2006, or places on the market a food 
which does not comply with those requirements, 

is guilty of an offence. 

(2) Notwithstanding paragraph (1) and subject to paragraph (3), a food 
business operator is not guilty of an offence under this Regulation where 
it placed on the market — 

(a) 

prior to 1 April 2021, a food containing trans fats other than 
trans fats naturally occurring in fat of animal origin which 
do not meet the conditions of use or the additional 
requirements in Part B of Annex III to EC Regulation 
1925/2006, or 

the conditions of use or 

(b) prior to 21 December 2022, a food containing green tea 
extracts containing (-)- epigallocatechin-3-gallate which do 
not meet 
the additional 
requirements in Part B of Annex III to EC Regulation 
1925/2006, which may remain on the market until 21 June 
2023, provided that, such foods were placed on the market 
in conformity with the provisions applicable thereto at the 
date of their placing on the market. 

(3) For the purposes of paragraph (2) (a) and (b), the food business 
operator shall bear the onus of proving that a food was placed on the 
market prior to 1 April 2021 or 21 December 2022, respectively.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 May, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [265] 5

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations give effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2022/860 of 1 
June 2022 and Commission Regulation (EU) 2022/2340 of 30 November 2022, 
both of which amend Annex III to Regulation (EC) No. 1925/2006 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council. 

Commission Regulation (EU) 2022/860 amends Annex III of Regulation (EC) 
No. 1925/2006 in two ways, first by placing monacolins from red rice yeast on 
the list of “Restricted substances” in the table in Part B and, second, by placing 
the same entry on the list of “Substances under Community scrutiny” in the table 
in Part C of that Annex. 

Commission Regulation (EU) 2022/2340 makes a similar amendment to Annex 
III of Regulation (EC) No. 1925/2006, placing green tea extracts containing (-)epigallocatechin-3-gallate on the list of “Restricted substances” in the table in 
Part B and the same entry on the list of “Substances under Community scrutiny” 
in the table in Part C of that Annex. 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Addition of Vitamins and 
Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 
376 of 2017) in the manner specified in these Regulations. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Addition of Vitamins 
and Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [265]
